        public ExecutorService getUpdateExecutor()
        This method returns an executor that is not meant for disk IO and that will be interrupted on shutdown.
        Returns:

      • getRecoveryExecutor

        public ExecutorService getRecoveryExecutor()
        In general, RecoveryStrategy threads do not do disk IO, but they open and close SolrCores in async threads, amoung other things, and can trigger disk IO, so we use this alternate executor rather than the 'updateExecutor', which is interrupted on shutdown.
        Returns:
        executor for RecoveryStrategy thread which will not be interrupted on close.
